bgu.dcr.az.api
Class Agent

java.lang.Object
  bgu.dcr.az.api.Agt0DSL
      bgu.dcr.az.api.Agent
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleAgent
public abstract class Agent
extends Agt0DSL

Agent is the main building block for a CP algorithms, it includes the algorithms main logic. This is The base class of SimpleAgent. The agents have only one entry point and one exit point Entry point: the function start() Exit point: the exit point is not accessed directly instead you can call one of the finish*(*) functions or call panic

Nested Class Summary
 class Agent.AgentProblem
          this is a wrap on the given problem - each agent posess a wrap like this instead of the actual problem
static class Agent.PlatformOperationsExtractor
          See documentation of PlatformOps.
 class Agent.PlatformOps
          this class contains all the "hidden but public" methods, because the user should extend the agent class all the "platform" operations can be called mistakenly by him, instead of making those operations private and then access them via reflection - which will create a decrease in the performance - we just hide them in this inner class.

static java.lang.String NCSC_STATISTIC
          the name of the statistic which collects the number of non concurrent steps of computation
static java.lang.String SYS_TERMINATION_MESSAGE
          the name for the system termination message the system termination message is getting sent only by the abstract agent
static java.lang.String SYS_TICK_MESSAGE
          the name for the system tick message the system tick message is getting sent only by the local search mailer when the system clock performs a 'tick' it wakes up the agent even if he doesn't have any messages - in order for him to re-tick the clock
 
Constructor Summary
Agent()
          create a default agent - this agent will have id = -1 so you must reassign it
 
Method Summary
protected  void beforeMessageSending(Message m)
          override this function in case you want to make some action every time before sending a message this is a great place to write logs, attach timestamps to the message etc.
 void broadcast(Message msg)
          broadcast a new message - prefer using broadcast(String msg, Object...
 void broadcast(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
          send the given message+arguments to all other agents except the sender (read the method send javadoc for more details about sending the message)
 int costOf(Assignment a)
          same as calling a.calcCost(getProblem()); accept - if a is null returns infinity
protected  Message createMessage(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object[] args)
          creates a message object from the given parameters and attach some metadata to it.. you can override this method to add some more metadata of your own on each message that your agent sends or even modify the message being sent just use super.createMessage(...) to retrieve a new message and then modify it as you please
protected  void finish()
          stop execution of current agent - will not affect other agents most of the times the desired function to call is finish(current-assignment) or finish(full-assignment) this function is here so that you can implement your own shutdown mechanism
protected  void finish(Assignment ans)
          stop execution - returning the given assignment, will cause a TERMINATION message to be sent to all other agents, if ans is null there is no solution
protected  void finish(int currentAssignment)
          call this function when an agent is done and want to report its assignment upon finishing
protected  void finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments()
          Deprecated. when all the agents call finish, their submitted partial assignments get collected and returned as the result of the execution - unless you called finish(fullAssignment) which will replace all the partial assignments
protected  void finishWithNoSolution()
          stop the execution (send TERMINATION to all agents) without solution - this method should be used in csp problem as it make sense there.

 void handleTermination()
          this function is called when a SYS_TERMINATION Message Arrived -> it just calls finish on the agent, you can override it to make your own termination handling but dont forgot to reassign it to the termination message. you should override it as follows: {@code

 void onIdleDetected()
          a callback which is called when idle detected - this is the place to finish the algorithm or revive from idle
 void onMailBoxEmpty()
          a callback which is called (only when running in synchronized mode) just before the next tick (when the agent finish handling all its messages)
abstract  void processNextMessage()
          request the agent to process the next message (waiting if the agents message queue is empty)

 SendMediator send(java.lang.String msg, java.lang.Object... args)
          sends a new message the message should have a name and any number of arguments the message which will be sent here will be received by an agent in the method that defines @WhenReceived with the name of the message (case sensitive!)
abstract  void start()
          this function called once on each agent when the algorithm is started
protected  void submitCurrentAssignment(int currentAssignment)
          the agent can submit its assignment so that when the function finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments will get called this will be the assignment to be accumulated - if you want to re-assign a new value you don't have to call unSubmitCurrentAssignment, you can just call this function again with the new value
protected  void unSubmitCurrentAssignment()
          remove the submitted current assignment
 void waitForNewMessages()
          waits for new messages to arrive

getProblem

protected ImmutableProblem getProblem()
Returns:
the problem currently being worked on each agent has its own unique instance of the problem (based on the global problem that was given to the simulator) and he manages it differently - so if you are building tools that have to be sent with the mailer to other agents don't include the agent's problem in them as a field.

getNeighbors

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getNeighbors()
Returns:
set of variables that are constrainted with this agent variable

getId

public int getId()
Returns:
the id of this agent. In simple algorithms this ID is the variable that the agent is "handling" starting from 0 to number of variables - 1

finish

protected void finish(Assignment ans)
stop execution - returning the given assignment, will cause a TERMINATION message to be sent to all other agents, if ans is null there is no solution

Parameters:
ans -

finishWithNoSolution

protected void finishWithNoSolution()
stop the execution (send TERMINATION to all agents) without solution - this method should be used in csp problem as it make sense there. This is the same as calling finish(null)

finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments

@Deprecated
protected void finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments()
Deprecated. when all the agents call finish, their submitted partial assignments get collected and returned as the result of the execution - unless you called finish(fullAssignment) which will replace all the partial assignments

finish

protected void finish()
stop execution of current agent - will not affect other agents most of the times the desired function to call is finish(current-assignment) or finish(full-assignment) this function is here so that you can implement your own shutdown mechanism

finish

protected void finish(int currentAssignment)
call this function when an agent is done and want to report its assignment upon finishing

Parameters:
currentAssignment -

submitCurrentAssignment

protected void submitCurrentAssignment(int currentAssignment)
the agent can submit its assignment so that when the function finishWithAccumulationOfSubmitedPartialAssignments will get called this will be the assignment to be accumulated - if you want to re-assign a new value you don't have to call unSubmitCurrentAssignment, you can just call this function again with the new value

Parameters:
currentAssignment - the assignment to submit

unSubmitCurrentAssignment

protected void unSubmitCurrentAssignment()
remove the submitted current assignment

getSubmitedCurrentAssignment

protected java.lang.Integer getSubmitedCurrentAssignment()
Returns:
the last submitted assignment will throw InvalideValueException if no assignment was submitted

start

public abstract void start()
this function called once on each agent when the algorithm is started

isFirstAgent

public boolean isFirstAgent()
Returns:
true if this is the first agent current implementation only checks if this agent's id is 0 but later implementations can use variable arranger that can change the first agent's id

isLastAgent

public boolean isLastAgent()
Returns:
true if this is the last agent current implementation just checks if this agent's id +1 is num_of_vars but later implementations can use variable arranger that can change the last agent's id

costOf

public int costOf(Assignment a)
same as calling a.calcCost(getProblem()); accept - if a is null returns infinity

a -

getDomain

public ImmutableSet<java.lang.Integer> getDomain()
Returns:
this agents full domain - as immutable set - if you need to change your domain- copy this set and then change your copy : HashSet currentDomain = new HashSet(getDomain());

getDomainSize

public int getDomainSize()
same as getDomain().size()

Returns:

isConstrained

public boolean isConstrained(int var1,
                             int var2)
Parameters:
var1 -
var2 -
Returns:
true if var1 is constrained with var2 which means : there is val1 in domainOf[var1] and val2 in domainOf[var2] where getConstraintCost(val1, var1, var2, val2) != 0

isFinished

public boolean isFinished()
Returns:
true if this agent called one of the finish methods (or panic.. )

broadcast

Parameters:

send

public SendMediator send(java.lang.String msg,
                         java.lang.Object... args)
sends a new message the message should have a name and any number of arguments the message which will be sent here will be received by an agent in the method that defines @WhenReceived with the name of the message (case sensitive!) and the arguments will be inserted to the parameters of that method usage: send("MESSAGE_NAME", ARG1, ARG2, ..., ARGn).to(OTHER_AGENT_ID)

Parameters:
msg - the message name
args - the list (variadic) of arguments that belongs to this message
Returns:
continuation class

send

public SendMediator send(Message msg)
send a new message - prefer using send(String msg, Object... args)

Parameters:
msg -
Returns:

onIdleDetected

public void onIdleDetected()
a callback which is called when idle detected - this is the place to finish the algorithm or revive from idle

onMailBoxEmpty

public void onMailBoxEmpty()
a callback which is called (only when running in synchronized mode) just before the next tick (when the agent finish handling all its messages)

handleTermination

public void handleTermination()
this function is called when a SYS_TERMINATION Message Arrived -> it just calls finish on the agent, you can override it to make your own termination handling but dont forgot to reassign it to the termination message. you should override it as follows: 
 {@code

getSystemTimeInTicks

public long getSystemTimeInTicks()
Note: the concept 'system time' only exists in synchronized execution

Returns:
the number of ticks passed since the algorithm start (first tick is 0), you can read about the definition of tick in agent zero manual

getAlgorithmName

public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
Returns:
the registered algorithm name for this agent
